definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: However, the past appraisement of them has been suffeting from being confined to their divergency in political standpoint.
sentences.chinese: 過去對他們的評價較多地拘泥於其政治立場的差異。

sentences.english: Secondly, the political facts of the magazine Lunyu.
Some of you are politically right wing.
sentences.chinese: 有些同學的政治立場是右翼的。

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
